Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
ABOUT NUR INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITYNUR International University (NIU), Lahore is an upcoming private, comprehensive university located in the Raiwind area of Lahore, and is a sister concern of the Fatima Memorial System (FMS), a center of excellence, serving Pakistan since 1977. The NUR-FMS Group has several educational entities attached to it, which include our Schools of Health Sciences (FMH College of Medicine & Dentistry, FMH Institute of Allied Health Sciences, Saida Waheed College of Nursing), and NUR International University. Fatima Memorial Hospital, Lahore, serves as our clinical training hub for programmes that require it. Our Schools of Health Sciences are currently leaders in their fields, with our students regularly achieving top positions in the University of Health Sciences.As part of commitment to Pakistan growth and development, and our continued aim to enable thought leaders who can bring transformative change to Pakistan, the NUR-FMS Group launched NUR International University in 2015, which is affiliated with HEC, chartered by Government of Punjab, accredited by Association of Commonwealth Universities, and a member of Talloires Network. NUR International University currently has the following faculties: Faculty of Social Sciences, Arts & HumanitiesFaculty of Management Sciences Faculty of Applied SciencesFaculty of Basic SciencesFaculty of Nursing and Allied Health Sciences
NUR International University achieves excellence and distinction by investing in exceptional people to think, care, create, and pursue excellence. Our motto for our students is â€˜Enabling Thought Leadersâ€™. We embrace discovery in a close nurturing environment that leads to genuine transformation of our students. Our community is diverse, dynamic, and dedicated to discovery and excellence in teaching, scholarship and practice. ROLE DESCRIPTIONNUR International University is currently seeking an accomplished leader to serve as Dean of its School of Psychology, which is part of the Faculty of Social Sciences, Arts & Humanities. The Dean of School of Psychology will contribute to the continuing development of a robust university-wide priority to develop models of interprofessional education, practice and research. That interprofessional setting, along with the NUR-FMS Groupâ€™s strong history of clinical training, science, and research, provides students with a distinctive, integrated education in psychology. Located on a modern campus, the School of Psychology provides students with robust academic training as well as supervised practical training across a network of clinical training sites in Lahore, including Fatima Memorial Hospital.Â The School of Psychology also runs the NUR Center for Well-being at NUR International University, aimed to provide support to staff as well as students at the University. The School of Psychology currently offers the following progammes: BS Applied PsychologyBS Clinical PsychologyMS Clinical PsychologyAdvanced Diploma in Clinical Psychology
In addition to contributing visionary leadership to these evidence-based training programs, the Dean will also be able to pursue personal academic and scholarly interests and continue to cultivate a collaborative academic community deeply committed to diversity, equity and inclusion.The Dean will have overall responsibility for the leadership and management of the School of Psychology and its programs, will be the Schoolâ€™s chief academic and budget officer, and represent the School on university committees and groups, as required. The Dean will also serve as a visible, engaged representative of the School and the university to the external community. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of issues and trends concerning undergraduate and graduate level clinical and applied psychology education, research, and practice, as well as a working knowledge of the role of applied clinical and research psychology relative to the other health professions represented at NUR International University and the NUR-FMS Group. A strong appreciation for models of practice that encourage and leverage integrated and interprofessional, team-based, and client-centered care are central to the training of all of our students. Ideally, the incoming Dean will: have a record of successful scholarly achievement, academic leadership experience, academic program development, excellence in teaching and practice, and financial management experience;embrace models of broad and general undergraduate and graduate psychology education and trainingbe committed to curricular infusion of diversity and equity knowledge, awareness, and skills and will foster an inclusive climate;support the Schoolâ€™s endeavors to serve marginalized communities (e.g. via community practicum sites);support the facultyâ€™s research and scholarly endeavors and provide leadership to the clinical and research aspects of the curricula and servicesThe position requires a thorough understanding of contemporary undergraduate and graduate level psychology education that emphasizes applied clinical and research paradigms and trends on the national and regional levels. The Dean will have the opportunity to define a more influential role for the School in the clinical psychology profession, capitalizing on the NUR-FMS Groupâ€™s strengths in applied clinical education and research.The Dean can be expected to take on a transformational focus, advancing the strategic vision of the School to become a more visible, recognized leader in the applied clinical psychology education, research, and practice communities. The role requires experience with and a commitment to visionary strategic planning, assessment, and continuous programmatic improvement. The Dean will collaborate with the faculty and other academic leaders in the College to define the future of the School, articulating emerging needs and addressing challenges that require new thinking, including potential new degree programs and delivery platforms.One of the positionâ€™s key responsibilities is to work effectively with the Schoolâ€™s faculty and staff, inspiring their energy and creativity for the benefit of the entire School and fostering a collaborative, team-building atmosphere among them and with other faculty and staff across the university, coordinating and managing the admission and recruitment of new students in cooperation with the programsâ€™ admissions staff and the Schoolâ€™s staff. The Dean will work with key community representatives to form strategic partnerships that support clinical education, practice innovation, and productive scholarly and research collaborations. The Dean will weave these elements together to contribute to advancing contemporary applied clinical psychology practice and research, and to ensure that the Schoolâ€™s programs appropriately meet standards for accreditation by relevant bodies.A successful Dean will embrace learner-centered, interprofessional, and inquiry-based education, value and support the Schoolâ€™s research and scholarship enterprise, foster faculty efforts to secure external grant funding, and demonstrate commitment to students and to the profession through professional service and/or voluntary activities.The Dean is responsible for maintaining strong relationships within the profession and with relevant government agencies and professional associations. The Dean will also foster positive relationships with the Schoolâ€™s alumni and other community stakeholders.
ESSENTIAL ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA QualificationsPhD, PsyD degree, or EdD in Psychology or related discipline. A doctoral degree from a top tier international university will be preferred.Academic &Administrative Experience: At least 15-years of experience in teaching, research and administration out of which 5 years should be in a similar leadership position in an HEC recognized University.Clinical Experience: Candidates who have minimum five yearsâ€™ experience in practicing psychology will be given preference.Minimum Number of Publications: The applicant must have 15 research publications with at least 5 publications in the last 5 years in HEC recognized journals. Preference will be given to those who have publications in high impact factor journals.Remuneration: A competitive package commensurate to the candidateâ€™s skillset and experience will be offered.ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS A capacity to envision the future for the program in conjunction with others.Budget experience with revenue and expenditure projectionsWillingness to develop new degree programs. Strong business acumen and marketing ability.Ability to identify new opportunities for psychologists.Knowledge of HEC Standards of Accreditation, procedures for accreditation, and Accreditation Implementing Regulations.Administrative experience and demonstrated leadership qualities in areas related to academia and health service practice.A history of scholarly achievement and recognition.A sophisticated grasp of scientific methodologies and practices.Demonstrated excellence in full-time academic teaching, scholarship, and service to the profession commensurate with appointment as a tenured full professor.Understanding of, commitment to, and possession of skills to develop and implement new opportunities for health service psychology consistent with national trends in healthcare.Excellent and flexible interpersonal skills with the ability to relate equally well and collaborate with administrators, faculty, students, and staff.Ability to select new personnel who will integrate well into the organization.
Applications: Please upload yourÂ cover letter, curriculum vitae, names and contact numbers of two professional references, a recent passport sized photograph and a letter of interest stating why you feel you should be considered for the position. NUR International University is an equal opportunity employer. Only shortlisted candidates will be interviewed.#JobsinLahore #career #Psychology #Psychologycareer

Position SummaryThe candidate will be responsible to set the strategic agenda and delivery of the Digital / Non-Cash Banking Channel for Business (Branch & Hybrid). The position requires experience in the development & implementation of digital processes and tools including credit scoring models and other risk analytics models in the Product Programs for both assets and liability products. The incumbent will be jointly responsible with Product Heads to achieve balance sheet growth, customer acquisition and profit and loss. The incumbent is responsible for planning, developing and execution of the Bank's Alternate Delivery Channel Operations.The Candidate must be an independent contributor with a high degree of passion with a strong understanding of handling data analytics, best in class digital lending products, credit policies and sale management. We require a person with a high degree of passion and skill to coordinate implementation across the organization. Job responsibilities Responsible for development and execution of the Bankâ€™s Transformation & Digitalization strategy.Develop and support new businesses through self-service acquisition, branch independent fulfilment, disbursal and collection executing of future roadmaps for products and services.Coordinate with Product Heads, Risk and Branch & Easy Paisa sales team (Merchants/Franchise etc.) for implementation of strategies.Responsible for Cash less channel compliance & regulatory requirement, including approvals for business plan, budget and selection of physical locations for Bankâ€™s distribution network.Responsible for daily management of the entire ADCâ€™s and UBP operations, all processes and teams housed in the ADC and UBP.Responsible to ensure that Bankâ€™s ATM uptime is in accordance with the regulatory requirements.Supervise, advise and monitor the work of the ADC and UBP Unit Head in their daily duties.Conduct meetings with SBP, Internal / External auditors and other regulatory authorities to address various issues that may occur.Responsible to develop, recommend and implements ATM strategies to take advantage of business opportunities, technology, and ATM network enhancements.Responsible for leading implementation of projects regarding ADC & UBP operations.Responsible for managing departmental level governance / coordination between stakeholders (both internal & external) in context of agreed regulatory framework, policies and business strategies. Liaise & coordinate with stakeholders to resolve bottlenecks & create synergy.Ensure all departmental processes & operating manuals are updated, in place and aligned with regulatory requirements.Conduct meetings with SBP, Internal / External auditors and other regulatory authorities to address various issues that may occur. Responsible for generating channel / digital process analysis, insights and other related reports to enable and enhance channel capabilities. Also responsible for generating MIS for management.Responsible to perform the scoping of business requirements and continuously work toward improving operating model, business viability, systems & enabling technology, intelligent location selection and execution. Introduce best in class model techniques to drive profitability and oversee development for advanced score and analytical tools including Statistical and Machine Learning Techniques in day-to-day operations of lending products.Create Score Cards for digital and hybrid lending products that encompass digital income valuation / loan limit assignment/ credit analytics and customer risk segmentation and collection algorithms.Partner within the organization and external parties to understand the source of new data and continue to improve the process of defining, extracting and utilizing new data.Lead digital design and solution architecture so that product / process is formulated, designed as per the market & customer requirement to achieve unit cost profitability.Manage and lead cross-functional project teams including close coordination with Business, Risk, Compliance, Human Resource, Operations and Technology for project planning & execution.Organize regular forums to keep track of performance, operations and strategic aspects and interact with various levels of management to facilitate understanding and usage of Scoring Models. Incumbent shall be responsible to adhere by Telenor Microfinance Bank Behaviours (Be Respectful, Keep Promises, Always Explore and Create Together) in all aspects of his/her work conduct.

Senior Compliance Officer   The Senior Compliance Officer will be responsible for the Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) assessment for all international students seeking admission to Western Sydney University, ensuring rigorous adherence to both immigration regulations and university policies.  The Senior Compliance Officer will conduct comprehensive evaluations of an applicant's background, considering their academic qualifications, financial stability, and immigration history to determine the authenticity of their intentions to pursue their studies at the University.  Key Responsibilities: Finalization of GTE assessments (including SOP and verifications from the bank over email) for Pakistan produced in line with university policy and procedures and in a timely manner.Successfully meet the agreed KPIs for turn-around times (48 hours) for GTE Assessment processing outcomes set by the Manager.Applications are referred in a timely manner to appropriate officers.Application data maintenance in the relevant university student management system is recorded with a high level of accuracy.Reports from the databases are reliable.Feedback on application quality and documentation is reported to Recruitment teams for discussions with agents.Meeting the (KPIs) on phone and email responses set by the Manager.Alert the Manager to emerging issues and recommend improvements to processes and the student experience.Prospective students' needs are met and exceeded.Advice is provided to agents on the progress of applications in a timely manner.Effective and efficient advice is provided to relevant university staff with regard to GTE assessment processes.Support and advice are provided to international students in line with relevant policy.Provide regular reports on conversion outcomes to the Associate Director, International Admissions and ComplianceContribute to the development of a respectful service culture of mutual support and continuous professional growth.
Essential Skills, Knowledge, and Experience: Demonstrated negotiation and communication skills, including the ability to drive continuous improvement.Proven expertise in extracting and analyzing data and preparing statistical reports and analyses for senior management.Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the impact of overseas education systems and qualifications on eligibility assessment, visa risk, market competitiveness, and compliance.Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to exercise initiative and sound judgment.Demonstrated a high level of organization and administrative skills, including prioritizing complex work schedules and meeting deadlines.Demonstrated high-level interpersonal and written communication skills, and experience developing stakeholder relationships, providing customer service, and drafting documentation.
Desirable Skills: Success in a sales role within the Higher Education sector.Working with stakeholders to develop sound working relationships and partnerships.
About Navitas   Since 1994, Navitas has been a respected leader in global higher education. As pioneers in the university pathway sector, we have trusted partnerships with more than 30 forward-thinking universities in Australia, New Zealand, the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, The Netherlands, the United Arab Emirates, Singapore, and Sri Lanka. We provide our partners with access to resources and expertise to help drive large-scale initiatives that provide tangible, lasting benefits to students, faculty, staff, and local communities.   What We Offer   Navitas is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our students and communities in which we live and serve.   Diversity and Inclusion   Navitas promotes and embraces an inclusive and diversified workforce. We believe equality, flexibility, and diversity in the workplace will deliver a rich and collaborative environment for our employees, students, and clients.   We encourage applications from candidates with disabilities, of all ages and genders, and diverse community groups.   How to apply   Please apply online by submitting your CV and Cover Letter.   Applications close on Sunday 22nd October 2023. However, we reserve the right to progress or confirm applicants prior to the closing date. Applications received after the closing date may be considered pending the recruitment process.   Extra information   For further information or to view other opportunities, please visit navitas.com/careers.   Successful candidates will require full working rights in Pakistan.   By submitting your application, you acknowledge and agree to Navitas' Privacy policy. Further information can be found at navitas.com/career.

To use process and performance evaluations to improve the impact of the programmeâ€™s activities. Role Purpose The Team Leader is responsible for designing, leading, and delivering the MEL programme. This Programme will most likely begin in 2024 and will run for 5 years. The scope of this programme will be limited to Pakistan, with the team located in Islamabad. A key requirement of this role is to ensure that the objectives, deliverables and outcomes are met and that the Team adheres to client (the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office) operational, commercial and reporting requirements. Therefore, experience working with the FCDO or its predecessors would be very advantageous. Responsible for the timeliness and quality of all written deliverables required by FCDO. Drafts content and provides quality assurance on reports. Responsible for quality of data and rigour of findings. Ensures data quality and ethics controls and protocols are in-place and adhered to. Experience managing a range of stakeholders to develop agreements in approaches and strategy. Significant experience in designing MEL and/or research programmes. Experience designing theories of change and contributing to monitoring, evaluation and learning. Familiarity with FCDO and/or UK government MEL, reporting, and data quality requirements preferred. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented product people and engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our product people and engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.If youâ€™re passionate about designing and delivering high-quality software, we'd love to hear from you.What You Will Be Doing Breaking down high-level milestones into requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteriaIterating with our designers to transform use cases and user stories into functional UX/UI prototypesTaking any important technical decisions you feel strongly about (e.g., data model, 3rd-party patterns to use)Reviewing and accepting engineering deliverables, ensuring it meets all of your requirements

About TrilogyHundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!Working with CrossoverThis is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. You'll assess drafts from the AI, provide targeted feedback, and adjust AI prompts to ensure the output is perfectly attuned to our brand voice, industry best practices, and core messaging. This is not about personally tweaking and refining AI-created content but guiding the AI to make necessary improvements, optimizing the synergy of human insight and AI execution to create compelling narratives.If you're intrigued by the intersection of human creativity, AI technology, and education, and love the idea of using AI to produce content that resonates, gt.school is where you belong.What You Will Be Doing Utilizing advanced AI tools to generate initial drafts of various marketing contentScrutinizing and refining AI-generated drafts to create high-quality marketing contentEnsuring alignment with brand inputs and industry best practices within all written outputsKeeping track of and iterating the AI prompts for continuous improvementCollaborating with stakeholders to effectively translate core ideas into a compelling brand narrative

We support peace and prosperity by building connections, understanding and trust between people in the UK and countries worldwide.We work directly with individuals to help them gain the skills, confidence and connections to transform their lives and shape a better world in partnership with the UK. We support them to build networks and explore creative ideas, to learn English, to get a high-quality education and to gain internationally recognised qualifications.Working with people in over 200 countries and territories, we are on the ground in more than 100 countries. In 2021â€“22 we reached 650 million people.HE Programme ManagerRole PurposeLeads the successful delivery of a range of education projects from start to finish including managing the contract or project plan, managing client or internal stakeholders, successfully achieving reporting and meeting compliance standards. Or works within a larger programme or multi country programme on a particular component. These can be funded by British Council or by another client or funding mechanism.Main Accountabilities But Not Limited To The FollowingRelationship & Stakeholder management Has relationships with delivery partners and stakeholders within country and is able to procure services and contract delivery partners.Holds suppliers to account for delivering against contract.Build strong internal relationships and networks
Commercial and Financial Management  Ensure sound financial planning, working closely with finance teams to ensure British Council and client financial year plans are up to date. Ensure accurate and timely monthly (re)forecasting is in place, by running regular reports in the SAP system on actuals, monitoring outstanding purchase orders, reviewing commitments, analysing and commenting on reasons for variances to plan and recommending corrective actions.Monitoring monthly finances, including correct expenditure, ensuring the P2P process is being followed and correcting any mis-postings or journals needed.Lead on British Council, partner or client reporting (including, with Finance Manager, financial reporting) and ensure reports are delivered on time, to budget and to a high standard.Compliance to BC financial policies and procedures.
Project Management  Contributes to development of, owns and delivers on Project Management PlanIdentifies risks in a project or programme and puts together mitigation strategies with SROResponsible for internal and client, procurement, contracting, compliance and reporting pmChecks on and reports on compliance Manages procurement on a project/programmeResponsible for data management including timely data entry, quality assurance of data, undertaking basic analysis of monitoring data, and developing progress reports to meet funding needsUndertaking programme-specific data collection as needed. This includes working with colleagues to identify indicators and tools for data collection, quality assuring all data, and undertaking basic analysis
Minimum/essentialRole specific knowledge and experience: Experience of managing projects from start to finish and familiarity with project life-cycles.Understanding of procurement, evaluation and reporting requirements of projects.Proven experience of managing project finances.Experience of managing stakeholders Project management qualification desirable.More than 2 years working in project or programme management. Experience of using technology n project delivery.Good understanding and experience of supporting monitoring and evaluation
Role Specific Skills Some knowledge of the UK and Pakistan Higher Education and /or relevant education sector Experience of delivering externally funded projects or programmes Experience of engaging with diverse stakeholders including multilateral agencies, donors, government official academics. Written and verbal proficiency in English is required.
Further InformationVacancy â€“ 1Pay Band â€“ 6/GContract Type â€“ Indefinite contract - LocalLocation â€“ Karachi, PakistanRequirements - Candidates must have the pre-existing right to live and work in Pakistan.Closing Date â€“ Monday, 23 October 2023.A connected and trusted UK in a more connected and trusted world.Equality , Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI) StatementThe British Council is committed to policies and practices of equality, diversity and inclusion across everything we do. We support all staff to make sure their behaviour is consistent with this commitment. We want to address under representation and encourage applicants from under-represented groups, in particular, but not exclusively, on grounds of ethnicity and disability. All disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria are guaranteed an interview and we have Disability Confident Employer Status. We welcome discussions about specific requirements or adjustments to enable participation and engagement in our work and activities.The British Council is committed to safeguarding children, young people and adults who we work with.We believe that all children and adults everywhere in the world deserve to live in safe environments and have the right to be protected from all forms of abuse, maltreatment and exploitation as set out in article 19, UNCRC (United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child) 1989.Appointment to positions where there is direct involvement with vulnerable groups will be dependent on thorough checks being completed; these will include qualification checks, reference checks, identity & criminal record checks in line with legal requirements and with the British Councilâ€™s Safeguarding policies for Adults and Children.If you have any problems with your application please email askhr@britishcouncil.orgPlease note: Applications to this role can only be considered when made through the Apply section of our careers website. Emails with supporting statements and CV/Resumes sent to this email address will not be reviewed and will be deleted.

About the job
            

 
About KodiflyKodifly is a leader in Spatial Intelligence and Infrastructure Monitoring, specializing in Intelligent Transportation System solutions. Our core technologies include 3D point cloud processing, real-time analytics, and state-of-the-art LiDAR technology. We are seeking a Full Stack Software Engineer with a strong focus on backend and frontend development to join our team.Position OverviewThe Full Stack Software Engineer will be responsible for developing and optimizing the backend and frontend components of our real-time analytics and 3D point cloud processing platforms. This role is critical for ensuring seamless integration with LiDAR technology, point cloud streaming, and video streaming services.Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain scalable backend services.Implement asynchronous task queues for data processing.Manage data storage and retrieval operations.Integrate frontend components into the application.Ensure real-time data and point cloud streaming capabilities.Adhere to coding standards and best practices for software development.
Technical Requirements & Qualifications Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or related field.Minimum 2 year of experience in software development with one year of leading a projectExperience with Django or FastAPI.Experience with Celery; Airflow knowledge is a plus.Must have worked with PostgreSQL.Experience with ReactJs + Typescript.Familiarity with message brokers like Kafka, ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ.Must understand SOLID principles and Unit Testing.Experience in building real-time, low-latency applications.AWS knowledge including VPC, EC2, S3.Must have a computer capable of running Docker and a minimum understanding of Linux.Deep understanding of point cloud streaming protocols and video streaming technologies is highly desirable.
Benefits Competitive salary with performance bonuses.Opportunity to work on groundbreaking technologies.

We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer: The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented product people and engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our product people and engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.If youâ€™re passionate about designing and delivering high-quality software, we'd love to hear from you.What You Will Be Doing Breaking down high-level milestones into requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteriaIterating with our designers to transform use cases and user stories into functional UX/UI prototypesTaking any important technical decisions you feel strongly about (e.g., data model, 3rd-party patterns to use)Reviewing and accepting engineering deliverables, ensuring it meets all of your requirements

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
OverviewWorking at AtlassianAtlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or from an office (unless it's necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia, New Zealand and Philippines. You will work in a remote role where office attendance is optional.Your future teamYou will report to the Engineering Manager of the Network Service Fabric team. The Service-to-Service Fabric squad builds and operates the service fabric that interconnects Atlassian microservices that power our products. Our service fabric empowers thousands of Atlassian developers, by taking care of the heavy lifting common to all of our services, such as observability, HTTP performance optimisation and resiliency. We maintain a high-quality bar through test-driven development, fast dev loops, pair programming and more.If you embrace DevOps and YBIYRI, and have experience with teamwork, then come and help us build solutions that operate at a global scale.ResponsibilitiesWhat you'll do Design, build, and support solutions to save time, and speed up delivery, for thousands of our internal developers by taking care of the heavy lifting common to all of our services, such as routing, authN, authZ, observability, HTTP performance optimisation, resiliency, chaos engineeringExplore and decide on new technologies, implement proof of concepts and be involved in important production projects in the service to service communication spaceContribute to code reviews, documentation, and complex bug fixes with security, performance and reliability in mindMentor and level up the skills of your teammates by sharing your expertiseHelp build Atlassianâ€™s service mesh, which connects thousands of microservices that power Atlassianâ€™s products and services.
QualificationsYour background 3+ years of industry experience working as a Backend Engineer or Systems EngineerDevelopment skills using programming languages like Golang, Typescript and PythonWillingness to work in a collaborative team using processes such as TDD and Pair ProgrammingExperience with CI/CD tools and practicesHave good networking fundamentals such as HTTP, Load BalancingExperience with diagnosing issues in high-throughput web applications and network services
We'd Be Super Excited If You Have Experience with service mesh technologies including Istio and EnvoyExperience contributing to the Istio and Envoy open-source communitiesExperience in TDD and Pair ProgrammingExperience building, running and optimising applications written in Go / Typescript Experience monitoring cloud services with SignalFX, Splunk and other Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code frameworks such as CloudFormation and Terraform Experience building, automating, and maintaining cloud infrastructure in AWS using VPC, EC2 compute
Solving problems in the Service-to-Service Fabric squad provides solutions for thousands of Atlassian engineers.Our perks & benefitsTo support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.About AtlassianThe world's best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team .We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub .

Job Desception:
About the job
            

 
Are you a high-performing product manager with a deep technical background who believes in designing solutions to help customers run their businesses effectively?Do you want to work for a best-in-class 100% remote organization with the brightest talent worldwide?As a Technical Product Manager at Sparkrock, you will have the opportunity to solve real-world problems for customers.Sparkrock helps social benefit organizations like nonprofits, school boards, and government agencies to reach their greatest potential using technology. We help to make these mission-driven organizations more efficient, freeing up their time and resources to focus on the good they want to achieve. Nearly 45,000 people use our ERP & CRM products daily to make the world a better place, and weâ€™re looking to double our impact in the next three years.Digital Transformation around industries began a few years ago. A lot is yet to be done. You will have the unique opportunity to help design solutions to help customers navigate through their digital transformation journey.You will be using Microsoftâ€™s Business Central as the key toolset, but you will also explore other solutions to integrate with to have the ideal experience.We seek a super technical product manager to help us design the best solutions for our ERP product, Spark. Someone who understands not only the product capabilities but also the underlying technology.If you are highly motivated and love building and growing, this is the place for you.What You Will Be Doing Writing product specs with adequate technical details for developers and sufficient overview and background for executives and non-technical team members.Meeting with customers, implementation consultants, sales & marketing, and support to understand key customer pain points.Brainstorm ideas for product roadmap.Understanding Microsoftâ€™s roadmap for Business Central and keeping up with their releases.
What You Will NOT Be Doing Writing codeCreating high-fidelity product mockupsScrum masterWriting user stories
What You Will Learn Deeper product-market understanding of key sectors we operate in: K-12, Human Services, and Not for Profit.Write concise, yet self-contained product specification documents.Interesting AI use cases and how to use AI to solve real-world problems.
Responsibilities Develop product specs for the technical team to develop solutions.Develop an understanding of the core Finance and HCM product features.Identify product gaps needed to solve real-world issues that our customers are facing.Develop an understanding of the markets we currently serve, K-12, human services, and non-profit.Develop an understanding of the different requirements between the US and Canadian markets.Be an expert in either Finance or HCM products.Develop an understanding of Microsoft Business Central products and how Sparkrock integrates with them.
Requirements 3 years implementing or developing an industry-standard ERP solution, e.g., Microsoft Business Central or NAV, Oracle NetSuite, SAP, etc.Previous software development or software-architecture experience with at least 1-year using AL programing language.10 years in a software company.Excellent written skills.Experience presenting in front of customers, internal staff, executives, and prospects.A post-secondary degree or diploma.
Nice to have Experience using cloud - Azure, AWS, or GCP.Experience in a SaaS product.Experience in AI.
Benefits - We donâ€™t call them perks, theyâ€™re just part of what makes working at Sparkrock great. We are 100% remote and global. Live your best life, wherever that may be, and never lose out on career opportunities because of it.Flexible work hours. We work asynchronously and donâ€™t care when youâ€™re online, just that you deliver great results.Dedication to development. We focus on career pathing for each and every one of our employees and help provide training to advance at every stage in your career.Focus on culture. Coffee chats, happy hours, cooking classes, book clubs, and more!Swag! Because who doesnâ€™t love swag?Stipend to help set up your ideal home officeIntroductions to thought leaders in the space and webinars on cutting-edge tech hot topics
We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities.
